oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-30 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 30, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Ford Rush with Ford Rush Jr., Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, Robert Lunn, and Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers (introduced by David Stone but not mentioned by George D. Hay). Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Ford Rush; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys; Robert Lunn; Ford Rush Jr.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified song, test band] (excerpt) -- Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Living On The Mountain, Baby Mine (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- My Old Kentucky Home (Ford Rush) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Cumberland Gap (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Robert Lunn -- Talking Blues (Robert Lunn) -- George D. Hay talks -- Careless Love (cast) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush and Ford Rush Jr. -- Ragtime Cowboy Joe (Ford Rush, Ford Rush Jr.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Shook, Jack; Missouri Mountaineers (Musical group); Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys; Lunn, Robert; Rush, Ford Jr.
